title: out by Tailte Éireann under section 3 of the Boundary Survey (Ireland) Act
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Maritime Boundaries (County of
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Maritime Boundaries (County of 

Sligo) Order 2024. 

(2) This Order shall come into operation on the 8th day of May 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited maritime boundary (county sligo) order 2024 (2) order shall come operation 8th day may 2024

title: out by Tailte Éireann under section 3 of the Boundary Survey (Ireland) Act
heading: In this Order -
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order - 

“the Plan” means the ordnance plan referred to and submitted with the Report; 

“present”, in relation to a boundary, means existing immediately before the 
coming into operation of this Order; 

“the Report” means the report of Tailte Éireann, relating to the maritime 
boundaries of the county of Sligo at Sligo Harbour and of its constituent 
denominations of land, namely, barony, parish, townland and electoral 
division, dated the 12th day of September 2023, and prepared, made out and 
submitted to the Government in accordance with section 11 of the Boundary 
Survey (Ireland) Act 1854. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 26th April, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [168] 3
text_norm: 2 order - plan mean ordnance plan referred submitted report present relation boundary mean existing immediately coming operation order report mean report tailte eireann relating maritime boundary county sligo sligo harbour constituent denomination land namely barony parish townland electoral division dated 12th day september 2023 prepared made submitted government accordance section 11 boundary survey (ireland) act 1854 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 26th april 2024 168 3

title: out by Tailte Éireann under section 3 of the Boundary Survey (Ireland) Act
heading: It is hereby directed that for all public purposes the boundary of the
text_raw:
3. 

It is hereby directed that for all public purposes the boundary of the 
county of Sligo at Sligo Harbour shall be deemed and taken to be the present 
boundary line as altered by the adoption of each of the changes proposed by 
Tailte Éireann which are marked out and described in the first to fourteenth 
paragraphs of the Report, headed sections A to H and J to O, and delineated in 
blue on the Plan.
text_norm: 3 hereby directed public purpose boundary county sligo sligo harbour shall deemed taken present boundary line altered adoption change proposed tailte eireann marked described first fourteenth paragraph report headed section h j delineated blue plan

title: out by Tailte Éireann under section 3 of the Boundary Survey (Ireland) Act
heading: 15. This Order together with the Report and Plan shall remain on record in
text_raw:
15. This Order together with the Report and Plan shall remain on record in 
the Office of the Secretary General to the Government and shall be exhibited to 
any person or persons who may desire to inspect the same, without fee or 
reward. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [168] 5 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

23 April, 2024. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Taoiseach.
